intro: Cicutaria maculata, commonly known as the spotted fennel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in dry to moderately moist conditions. Its distinctive spotted leaves and aromatic properties make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
